title: Christian Doermer
text:
Christian Doermer (born 5 July 1935) is a German actor and director. He has appeared in 83 films and television shows since 1954. He starred in the 1966 film "<a href="No%20Shooting%20Time%20for%20Foxes">No Shooting Time for Foxes</a>". The film was entered into the <a href="16th%20Berlin%20International%20Film%20Festival">16th Berlin International Film Festival</a>, where it won the <a href="Jury%20Grand%20Prix">Silver Bear Extraordinary Jury Prize</a>. In 1969, Doermer appeared as a German soldier attending the <a href="Christmas%20truce">Christmas truce</a> in Sir <a href="Richard%20Attenborough">Richard Attenborough</a>'s satirical <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a> musical film "<a href="Oh%21%20What%20a%20Lovely%20War">Oh! What a Lovely War</a>". 
Doermer himself has also directed a fair number of films including documentaries and television films. In 1962, he was one of the 26 authors of the famous <a href="Oberhausen%20Manifesto">Oberhausen Manifesto</a>, demanding a change in German film.
